abstract.p: World Policy Institute research associate Michelle Ciarrocca letter, responding to Aug 21 article on arms sales, says while US tries to demonize Russia and China for arming questionable countries, in rarely thinks twice about its role as world's top gunrunner

block.p: While the United States tries to demonize Russia and China for arming questionable countries, it rarely thinks twice about its role as the world's top gunrunner (news article, Aug. 21). Are we more responsible in deciding who can buy weapons? Given that we arm or train more than 150 countries, the answer must be no.

Our arms export policy is that arms and services shall be provided for internal security, legitimate self-defense and United Nations operations. But this runs counter to our foreign policy, which condemns the oppressive practices of totalitarianism and violations of human rights.

If America wants the moral high ground, it must end this contradictory policy and put human rights and democracy before profits and narrowly defined economic and strategic interests.
The writer is a research associate at the World Policy Institute.
